root.name: degrees()

example.code: rad = PI/4 deg = degrees(rad) println("%.3f radians is %d degrees" % (rad, deg))

root.description: Converts a radian measurement to its corresponding value in degrees. Radians and degrees are two ways of measuring the same thing. There are 360 degrees in a circle and 2*PI radians in a circle. For example, 90° = PI/2 = 1.5707964. All trigonometric functions in Processing require their parameters to be specified in radians.

parameter.label: radians
parameter.description: float: radian value to convert to degrees
